p: This case demonstrated the unusual characteristics of bacterial meningitis in a pregnant patient. The clinical evolution of the patient was characterized by a paradoxical clinical condition and neuroradiological worsening after induced labor, despite the use of greatly effective anti-infective therapy. CNS-IRIS induced by bacterial meningitis was diagnosed and treated with corticosteroids. To the best of our knowledge, this is the first case of CNS-IRIS related to bacterial meningitis.
